reviewText: This second season of "Touched By An Angel" is very good. They don't make shows like this anymore. And so far, there aren't anymore reruns of this show. Therefore, I recommend that all fans of this show should buy this set, along with Seasons 1 and 3. The only downfall about this set is that this is not it's best season. There are some good episodes, but most episodes aren't as good as the later seasons. Season 3 has better episodes. However, I still recommend this set to all fans.  Now, as far as the picture quality is, it's ok. It's not the best transfer. The main problem with the picture is that it's slightly grainy and looks muddy at times. Overall, it's not a bad transfer, so it doesn't bother me. As far as the sound quality is, it is alright. In my opinion, the Dolby Digital 2.0 stereo sound is quite weak. It doesn't have much bass to it. But I think it has a better sound quality than Season 1.
summary: Good season, but not it's best.
Title: N/A

reviewText: With seasons one and two out I'm aching for season Three to get out there!!!  I immediately went out and bought this the day it was released!  This is TBAA in its prime element.  Every episode is outstanding.  The disks have been beautifully packaged but the sad thing is, there are no extras in here.  But then again, this show doesn't need any!  It is enough to have the episodes in their entirety seeing them digitally remastered with vibrant color (OPERATION SMILE EPISODE CASE IN POINT IS BEAUTIFUL!!!!...YOU ALL MUST WATCH THIS ONE IF ONLY FOR THE CINEMATOGRAPHY!!!).  Without a doubt the most inspiring, edifying, morally satsifying television program ever!  CBS did us a disservice when it was canceled.  But watching the Season by Season DVDs are like watching TBAA for the first time!!  Now, get Season Three Out on the double!!!
summary: ALLRIGHT, NOW, GET SEASON THREE OUT THERE!!!!

reviewText: Nominated for 3 Golden Globes and 12 Emmys, including two by Della Reese for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series, Touched By An Angel built a sizeable and loyal audience with its upbeat themes and inspirational storylines. The brainchild of John Masius, creator of Providence (1999) and writer for such hit series as St. Elsewhere (1982) and LA Law (1986), Touched By An Angel follows in the footsteps of Michael Landon's successful series Highway To Heaven, which chronicled the exploits of a single angel who wandered across the United States providing support for lost souls in need of aid. Touched By An Angel is quite similar, but the series uses multiple angels to achieve its purpose. Like Highway To Heaven the series utilizes a contemporary setting and modern problems, allowing the show reach a broad audience who enjoy its themes of love, hope, and redemption...Touched By An Angel follows the exploits of several angels sent to Earth as "caseworkers" so as to bring God's message of love, peace, and hope to the distressed people of the world. When the series begins, Monica (Roma Downey) is a novice caseworker still in training (having just been promoted from "search & rescue"). Assisting Monica, and a caseworker in her own right, is Tess (Della Reese) who lends the wisdom of her many years of experience in dealing with the problems afflicting humanity at large. Together, these two angels interact with people on Earth, easing the burden of each soul with which they come into contact. In later seasons, Monica and Tess would be joined by Andrew (John Dye), the Angel of Death who also fills in as a caseworker to help lighten the load, and in the final two seasons (2001-2003), Gloria (Valerie Bertinelli) would join the trio as a regular recurring angel character... Overall, Touched By An Angel filled a desperately unmet need along the TV programming landscape. With much of today's programming fixated on sex, violence, and "reality," the hour-long CBS drama provided deeply probing family-oriented content which always left its viewers with a positive and upbeat feeling...The Touched By An Angel (Season 2) DVD features a number of touching episodes including the season premiere "Interview with an Angel" in which Monica is given the task of granting an interview to a journalist writing a piece on human encounters with angels. The reporter, Callie, is quite skeptical, but when Monica recounts the story of a couple that granted forgiveness to another person, Callie unwittingly becomes the subject of an angelic encounter herself... Other notable episodes from Season 2 include "The Big Bang" in which Monica reveals herself to a married couple intent on robbing a bank and exacting revenge on its president, and "Lost And Found" in which Monica and Andrew come to the aid of a troubled detective haunted by his failures while working for the Centre for Missing Children...Below is a list of episodes included on the Touched By An Angel (Season 2) DVD:Episode 12 (Interview with an Angel)Episode 13 (Trust)Episode 14 (Sympathy for the Devil)Episode 15 (The Driver)Episode 16 (Angels on the Air)Episode 17 (In the Name of God)Episode 18 (Reunion)Episode 19 (Operation Smile)Episode 20 (The Big Bang)Episode 21 (Unidentified Female)Episode 22 (The Feather)Episode 23 (The One That Got Away)Episode 24 ('Til We Meet Again)Episode 25 (Rock 'n' Roll Dad)Episode 26 (The Indigo Angel)Episode 27 (Jacob's Ladder)Episode 28 (Out of the Darkness)Episode 29 (Lost and Found)Episode 30 (Dear God)Episode 31 (Portrait of Mrs. Campbell)Episode 32 (The Quality of Mercy)Episode 33 (Flesh and Blood)Episode 34 (Birth Marks)Episode 35 (Statute of Limitations)The DVD Report
summary: A family-friendly breath of fresh air...

reviewText: In a television age when we are inundated with reality trash, crime trash and sitcom trash, it is refreshing that we can look back on Touched By an Angel and see the quality the USED to be on television.  Della Reese prophesied that the Lord told her it would be on for ten years (and it was) and she could retire after that.  If CBS had left it alone on SUnday nights, I think it could still be on the air because the show is timeless and would never run out of story ideas.  Martha Williamson, the show's producer show's her genius in great episodes of the second season including "Interview With an Angel", "Trust", and "Till We Meet Again".  You can have all of the reality, crime and sex sitcom nonsense.  Just let me be "Touched by an Angel".  And I agree...they are making us wait too long between releases!!!
summary: WHAT A BLESSING THIS PROGRAM IS!!

reviewText: This show is what modern TV programs lack- after watching each episode you feel a little better about your boring everyday life and end with a new found sense of faith. Each hour will bring a smile to face and make you believe that life despite your problems is worthwhile.I am a constant faith-doubter so seeing programs such as "Touched By An Angel" help reaffirm my faith in times of doubt... making me believe no matter how bad the situation that there IS something out there.The second season is ten times better than the first and re-affirms your beliefs if your beginning to doubt your faith and will even make the most cyncical want to believe. Seeing the show makes you believe in angels and the everyday heroics of the common man.I only wish they had released more seasons on DVD and that more shows like "Touched By An Angel" will follow- definately hit the buy now button and enjoy this show with your entire family-

reviewText: Nine years and over 200 episodes??  Remarkable run and with good reason!  This show did more to change my life than any other program.  It made me realize that I am loved by God, that Divine Intervention through His heavenly messengers is possible and that MY LIFE WILL BE CENTERED AROUND HIM!  This outstanding DVD set offering is a perfect example of what is good and right in this world and what is no longer being offered on television.  My favorite episode in this collection is "Till We Meet Again" with guest star, Joan Van Ark.  Cynics will call this sentimental pap, but that's o.k.  Give me sentimental pap any day.  The DVD reproduction is crisp and beautiful.  The sound is exceptional!  The only recommendation I have is to feature more extras next time around and don't make us wait so long for the next season!  Oh, and please release all the rest of the seasons.  We have two now, seven more to go.  If they can do it for trash like "Sex and the City" and "Will and Grace", they can do it for GOD!!
summary: THE BEST "GOD CENTERED" TV SERIES EVER!

reviewText: These shows are fantastic, heartwarming, and perhaps a great teaching tool about the love, mercy, and grace that God has promised His children. (as are all of the Touched By An Angel Productions) This set of discs, however, do not represent the entire season as stated. There may been others omitted as well, but it's a sure thing that the episode titled 'The feather', with Randy Travis as the older brother of younger, disabled Joey, is half of a two part show. They even begin the show with, "In the previous episode---------"  Now, just how stupid do the producers of these DVD's think we are? Sure, they can get by with leaving out a few episodes and calling it a complete season (after all, it's been a long time since we originally saw them in order), but when they go so far as to say an episode is the continuation of a former one (which wasn't there) I feel that my intelligence is being blatantly tested in a way I do not appreciate...perhaps to see how many episodes they can get by with leaving out next time? I don't know. But I do know it's not the first time episodes have been omitted from supposed 'complete seasons' of past T.V. shows (Not necessarily Touched By An Angel). Please let this fact in no reflect on the goodnes of this particular program, nor any of it's participants. The sole blame for these omissions lies in the hands of those re-producing these shows on DVD.
